alert.note: Alert for El Paso (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 21 at 7:40PM MDT until June 22 at 1:03PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Colorado... Arkansas River NEAR Avondale affecting Pueblo County. Fountain Creek Near Fountain affecting El Paso County. Fountain Creek Near Pinon affecting Pueblo County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Colorado... Fountain Creek At Colorado Springs affecting El Paso County. .Heavy rainfall expected overnight will cause the Fountain Creek and the Arkansas River at Avondale to rise above flood stage later tonight through tomorrow morning. The degree of flooding will depend highly on the amount of rain and where it falls. The forecasts below could change if heavier rainfall occurs. For the Lower Arkansas River...including Avondale...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Fountain Creek...including Colorado Springs, Fountain, Pinon, Pueblo...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fountain Creek At Colorado Springs. * WHEN...From this evening to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Homeless encampment below and near the Nevada Avenue bridge is affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 6.1 feet this evening. It will then rise above flood stage late this evening to 12.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight to 7.6 feet Friday afternoon then rise again. - Flood stage is 11.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.1 feet on 09/02/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Fountain Creek Colorado Spring 11.5 8.0 Wed 6 pm MDT 7.9 7.7 MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 745 AM MDT.
